Name: ParentIdentificationPortion
Description: Identifies the parent portions of the code string as individual segments. Repeat for each parental segment.

Name: UniqueIdentificationPortion
Description: Identifies the unique portion of the code string as a segment.

Name: ArrayBase
Description: The array base is the value of the designation for the first item in an array and is generally set to either 0 or 1. Unix based systems and most current programming systems use an array base of 0. Traditional codebooks normally set the array base at 1, for example the first data item in a fixed format ASCII file record begins at character 1.
